required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Norepinephrine Versus Phenylephrine Continuous Variable Infusion in Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Norepinephrine Versus Phenylephrine Continuous Variable Infusion for Prevention of Post-spinal Hypotension During Cesarean Delivery: A Randomized Controlled Double-blinded Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison will be conducted between continuous variable infusions of both drugs (Phenylephrine and Norepinephrine) with starting doses of 0.75 mcg/Kg/min and 0.1 mcg/Kg/min respectively for prophylaxis against Post-spinal hypotension during cesarean delivery

detailed_description.textblock: Maternal hypotension is a common complication after spinal anesthesia for cesarean delivery (CD). Many vasopressors have been used for prevention of post-spinal hypotension (PSH) during CD; however, the optimum protocol for prophylaxis is not established yet. Phenylephrine (PE) is a popular vasopressor used in obstetric anesthesia; however, its use is limited by its marked cardiac depressant nature. Norepinephrine (NE) is a potent vasopressor characterized by both α adrenergic agonistic activity in addition to a weak β adrenergic agonistic activity; thus, NE is considered a vasopressor with minimal cardiac depressant effect; these pharmacological properties would make NE an attractive alternative to PE. In this study, the investigators will compare continuous variable infusion of both drugs (PE and NE) with doses of 0.75 mcg/Kg/min and 0.1 mcg/Kg/min respectively for prophylaxis against PSH during CD.

primary_outcome.description: Defined as the percentage of patients with decreased systolic blood pressure less than 80% of the baseline reading

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of severe post-spinal anesthesia hypotension
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the percentage of patients with decreased systolic blood pressure less than 60% of the baseline reading
Defined as the percentage of patients with decreased systolic blood pressure less than 80% of the baseline reading
Systolic blood pressure measured in mmHg
number of heart beats per minute

secondary_outcome.measure: APGAR score for assessment of the general state of the fetus
secondary_outcome.description: APGAR score of the fetus ranging from 0 to 10. the higher the value, the better he score
Defined as the percentage of patients with increased systolic blood pressure more than 80% of the baseline reading
PH in the blood sample obtained from umbilical artery scaled from 1 to 14

secondary_outcome.measure: Umbilical arterial Partial pressure of Carbon dioxide
secondary_outcome.description: in the blood sample obtained from umbilical artery measured in mmHg
The percentage of patients with nausea
The percentage of patients with nausea
the total dose of phenylephrine consumed during the operation
the total dose of norepinephrine consumed during the operation
the total dose of ephedrine consumed during the operation

arm_group.description: Will receive spinal anesthesia using Bupivacaine. Then, phenylephrine infusion by a starting rate of 0.75 mcg/Kg/min. The rate will be then adjusted according to the patient blood pressure. The infusion will stop in case of reactive hypertension. The infusion will start again when blood pressure returns to normal reading. Infusion will be increased by 20% if hypotension occurred.

Will receive spinal anesthesia using Bupivacaine. Then, norepinephrine infusion by a starting rate of 0.1 mcg/Kg/min. The rate will be then adjusted according to the patient blood pressure. The infusion will stop in case of reactive hypertension. The infusion will start again when blood pressure returns to normal reading. Infusion will be increased by 20% if hypotension occurred.

intervention.description: Phenylephrine variable infusion with a starting rate of 0.75 mcg/Kg/min.
Norepinephrine variable infusion with a starting rate of 0.1 mcg/Kg/min.
Bupivacaine will be injected in the subarachnoid space with a dose of 10 mg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Full term
- Pregnant women
- Scheduled for cesarean section
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-eclampsia
- Eclampsia
- Bleeding
- Cardiac dysfunction

overall_official.affiliation: Head of research committee section in anesthesia department
